definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Blond - haired blue - eyed Westerners also come for a look-see .
sentences.chinese: 金发碧眼的洋人也来探个究竟。

sentences.english: So Marilyn dyed her brunette hair to a golden blonde.
sentences.chinese: 这样玛里琳把她的黑褐色头发染成了金发碧眼。

sentences.english: She is 28, blonde and quite beautiful.
The generality of Swedes are blonde.
sentences.chinese: 大多数瑞典人都是金发白肤碧眼者。

sentences.english: This blond man delivers newspaper every morning.
sentences.chinese: 这个白肤金发碧眼的男人每天早晨送报纸。
我喜欢金发碧眼白皮肤的女郎，你呢？

sentences.english: Her friends would have described her as a slim blonde.
sentences.chinese: 她的朋友都把她描写成一个秀丽的碧眼黄发的美人儿。

sentences.english: all with black hair and blue eyes.
The man behind you is 285 pounds, and he's blond too.
sentences.chinese: 他们和我一样也都是白肤金发碧眼。

sentences.english: She's tall and blond, not short and dark like me.
sentences.chinese: 她个子高，金发碧眼，不像我又矮又黑。

sentences.english: We were blonde-haired novelties immersed in a foreign culture.
sentences.chinese: 我们这群金发碧眼的大学生融入了一个异国文化之中。

sentences.english: He enjoys the company of tall skinny blondes.
sentences.chinese: 他非常喜欢这群又高又瘦的金发碧眼的美女。

definition: fox lady/in folk stories, a beautiful girl who will seduce you then reveal herself as a ghost
a legendary dragon with the ability to control rain and floods/see also 蛟龍|蛟龙[jiao1 long2]
demon in Buddhism/poltergeist in temple that plays tricks on monks and has a taste for their food
purple qipao gown, the sign of an official position
silver or black fox (Vulpes alopex argentatus)
